summary: This combines the obnoxious Belgian\'s Additional Music Packs I,II and III, adding up to 70 minutes of music. This bundle can now be customized, provided you have the Creation Kit.
descriptionHtml:
-IMPORTANT NOTE- 

This mod is out of date, please head to the [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28951] Additional Music Project [/url], thank you :). 

-INTRODUCTION-

This mod combines the Additional Music Packs I through III, which are smaller collections of additional music. I started working on this six months ago and now, after the release of the third pack, it might be a good idea to offer everything in one collection.

The idea behind these music packs is simple (and obvious): it\'s to add music (not replace) to the Skyrim (and where applicable, Oblivion) experience. I never capped myself in terms of how much music I was going to write, so this project will keep on going until run out of ideas/get tired of it/find something better to do. As Skyrim works its way to old age, I\'m aware of the fact that by the time I\'m done with this, most of you won\'t be playing this game anymore but hell, you might feel nostalgic at some point :). 

Furthermore, I\'m not a pro. I\'m just a guy having a lot of fun making these things and I just make the stuff I like to hear, so hopefully that resonates through the material. Feel free to comment and whatnot. Constructive feedback is always appreciated.

-CONTENTS-

71 minutes of extra music for Skyrim, ranging from battlemusic to exploring and dungeon tracks. 20 tracks in total. Vanilla music is unaltered, which means this bundle adds music only and replaces nothing.

4 Dragon Battle tracks
3 Regular Combat tracks
3 Dungeon tracks
4 Nighttime Exploring tracks
3 Daytime Exploring tracks
2 Evening Exploring tracks
1 Town track

In order for the esp to work, it needs to go in the /data folder and the xwm\'s need to go to /data/music/Additional Music Bundle I - III. If you don\'t have a /data/music folder, you need to create one. 

There is an optional additional file with the MP3 files for media players.

So, enjoy! I hope ^^ 

-PREVIEWS-

Dragon Combat

[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qHxHkecgoig]Trial By Fire[/url]

Combat

[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=agETmOYoTW8]For Old Time\'s Sake[/url]

Exploring

[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LgVDEXlIk9E]Frostfall[/url]

[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZUzOFiitC7o]The Quiet Life[/url]

Town

[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VeR6VkzkWSE]Peaceful Days Remembered[/url]

Dungeon

[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RK-XsdMMPqs]The Eerie Places[/url]

Check out the [url=http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1882B76E89DD57A1]Youtube playlist[/url] for all tracks!

-NEWS-

October 22nd: The action oriented themes have a [url=http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4epWpLKwfPMsEKcprR4NSVuoFcVeN_ux]seperate youtube playlist[/url].
October 28th: The exploration tracks have a [url=http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4epWpLKwfPONzcnDDsHMAcftbRV33gu8]seperate youtube playlist[/url].
November 11th: added a guide in the files section that enables people to edit which tracks are used in-game. For those that only like, for instance, 2 extra dragon combat songs. Must have the Creation Kit. 

-SPECIAL THANKS-

No_Aardvarks_Allowed for the great tutorial!
Badkrma for the idea of a bundle .
author: EvilBlueKoala
